intro: Senecio santurbanensis, commonly known as the Santurban's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Senecio santurbanensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
